intro: Erucaria lutescens, commonly known as the yellow erucaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
